alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 20 at 2:12PM CST until further notice by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in St Louis MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Illinois... Kaskaskia River at Carlyle TW. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kaskaskia River at Carlyle TW. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CST Sunday the stage was 423.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening and continue rising to 423.7 feet tomorrow morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 423.5 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Thu Fri Kaskaskia River Carlyle TW 423.5 423.2 Sun 1 pm 423.7 423.7 423.7 423.7 423. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Rainfall heavier than forecast could cause river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The NationalWeather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
